titleStmt.title: R. H. Davenport et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4301

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Midway October 6th/ 63
To his Excelency Thomas E. Bramblett
Governor of the State of Ky
We the undersigned Citizens of Woodford County, would respectfuly Petition your honor to Remit a fine of Seventy Dollars that was imposed on D. R. Price in Versailles on the 5th Oct 1863

Very Respectfully
Yours &c
R H Davenport) Trustee
John H Martin
John Coyle) Trustee
M. E. Poynter
T D Martin
Wm. N. Thomosson J. P. W. C
D. M. Jolly
Jacob Merryman
C W Norwood
S. T. Woolums) Trustee
John Sutton
Jas. W. Pates
J T Pates
S. B. Utterback
J W Martin) Trustee

John F. Warts
Sam. B. Wallace
Wm. R. Buford

S. W. Paine

T C Moore

Legrand Lucas
L. D. Cabler

D. Lehmann) Trustee
